meanings.definition: A plant of the nightshade family with a forked root believed to have magical properties.
meanings.sent1: In the old story, the witch brewed a potion using mandrakes to cast a spell.
meanings.sent2: The mandrakes in the garden were said to bring good luck to those who found them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome tried to use mandrakes to make his garden grow faster.
meanings.sent4: The mandrakes seemed to whisper secrets to the moonlight, their roots reaching deep into the earth.
meanings.sent5: The children gathered around the mandrakes, their eyes wide with wonder at the plant's mystical aura.

meanings.definition: The root of this plant, used in folklore and medicine.
meanings.sent1: The healer prepared a tonic using mandrakes to help soothe the villagers' ailments.
meanings.sent2: Legends spoke of the mandrakes' ability to cure even the most stubborn illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The mandrakes were so potent that even the birds avoided pecking at their roots.
meanings.sent4: As the mandrakes were harvested, their earthy scent filled the air with ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The mandrakes' roots were carefully dried and ground into a fine powder for medicinal purposes.
